revised_title: The Geological Age and Accumulation of Drift Deposits Containing Remains of Extinct Mammalia and Flint-Implements
tldr: The author investigates the conditions and geological age of drift deposits containing remains of extinct mammals and flint-implements. He examines the structure and origin of these deposits, concluding that they were formed by long-term river action rather than a catastrophic event. The author also discusses the differences between high-level and low-level gravels and their respective locations and contents.
